choices.D: Enable Smart Call Home feature during the firmware upgrade process.
choices.A: Get Full State and All Configuration backup files before beginning the upgrade.
choices.E: Run the Check Conformance feature to verify that all your components are running the compatible firmware version after the upgrade.
choices.B: Verify if the bootflash on the fabric interconnects in the Cisco UCS has at least 10% available space.
choices.C: Verify if the bootflash on the fabric interconnects in the Cisco UCS has at least 15% available space.

questions.question_text: Which two actions should be performed before upgrading the infrastructure and firmware of multiple UCS blades? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Ask is for "before the upgrade" That rules out E. Checking available bootflash space is listed in prereqs, 20% mentioned, guessing Q was written for older code so going with 15%

Selected Answer: AC
D => incorrect
E => it is important but after upgrade

B & C either could be correct, checking for available space is important, 15% is the more appropriate threshold compared to 10%

comments.content:
As per the document below, "when the bootflash partition exceeds 70 percent, faults are raised". It also mentions we should have at least 20% available space, otherwise Auto Install will not proceed.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Firmware-Mgmt/4-2/b_UCSM_GUI_Firmware_Management_Guide_4-2/b_UCSM_GUI_Firmware_Management_Guide_chapter_010.html

discussion.content: Will go for A, B. Question states: do stuff before. E is after upgrade procedure. Smartl call home should be disabled. This leaves us with two options: B,C. B is logically more suited, because of 90% raises faults in UCSM

comments.content:

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A storage engineer must monitor the traffic from the file server to the FC analyzer. The file server and the database use the same storage array. Which configuration must be applied to the Cisco MDS 9000 Series Switch to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
B should be correct

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5000/sw/system_management/503_n1_1/cisco_n5k_system_mgmt_cg_rel_503_n1_1_chapter15.pdf

Characteristics of Destination Ports
Each local SPAN session must have a destination port (also called a monitoring port) that receives a copy of
traffic from the source ports, VLANs, or VSANs. A destination port has these characteristics:
• Can be any physical port, Ethernet, Ethernet (FCoE), or Fibre Channel, and virtual Fibre Channel ports
cannot be destination ports.
• Cannot be a source port.
• Cannot be a port channel or SAN port channel group.
• Does not participate in spanning tree while the SPAN session is active.
• Is excluded from the source list and is not monitored if it belongs to a source VLAN of any SPAN
session.
• Receives copies of sent and received traffic for all monitored source ports. If a destination port is
oversubscribed, it can become congested. This congestion can affect traffic forwarding on one or more
of the source ports.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct!
Should really be 80 instead of 443 as Q reads "HTTP" not HTTPS but given answer only thing that makes sense

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is ok!

Selected Answer: A
The internal interface on the VTEP is configured as a layer-3 port. However, there is no IP assigned to it. It is also important to note that the BD value defined on the VTEP does not have to match the VLAN ID on the device from which you are sending the traffic. However, the dot1q to VNI mapping defined in the encapsulation profile, which is called under the service instance on the internal interface, must match the VLAN ID on the device from which you are sending the traffic.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus7000/sw/vxlan/config/cisco_nexus7000_vxlan_config_guide_8x/configuring-vxlan-flood-and-learn.html#:~:text=and%20Learn%20Configuration-,Example%20of%20VXLAN%20Flood%20and%20Learn%20Configuration,-The%20following%20example

questions.question_text: A Cisco Nexus 7000 Series switch runs VXLAN, and interface Ethernet 7/30 is configured as a trunk port. Which command set configures the switch to act as a gateway for VLAN 50? interface Ethernet7/30 no switchport no shutdown service instance 1 vni no shutdown encapsulation profile VSI_50_TO_500 default

choices.C: encapsulation profile vni VSI_50_TO_500 dot1q 500 vni 50 bridge-domain 500 member vni 50 interface Vlan500 ip address 10.50.50.51/24
choices.A: encapsulation profile vni VSI_50_TO_500 dot1q 50 vni 500 bridge-domain 50 member vni 500 interface Bdi50 ip address 10.50.50.51/24
choices.B: encapsulation profile vni VSI_50_TO_500 dot1q 500 vni 50 bridge-domain 500 member vni 50 interface Bdi500 ip address 10.50.50.51/24
choices.D: encapsulation profile vni VSI_50_TO_500 dot1q 50 vni 500 bridge-domain 50 member vni 500 interface Vlan50 ip address 10.50.50.51/24
